title: Diego Maradona steals the show after finally securing first win as Gimnasia boss with bizarre dance
text:
Diego Maradona showed off his dance moves after winning his first match in charge of Argentinian Primera Division side Gimnasia on Sunday.

The 58-year-old, who had surgery on his knees in the summer, wiggled his hips in the changing rooms as he celebrated the victory.

Gimnasia, who were lifted off the bottom of the table with a 4-2 win over Godoy Cruz, face another must-win match on Saturday when they face 21st Union at home.

Earlier this week, a furious Maradona sent seven of his senior players to the reserves

Earlier this week, a furious Maradona sent seven of his senior players to the reserves after a disastrous start to life as the manager of Gimnasia.

What began with a joyous celebration when he was unveiled last month, that quickly turned sour, with the team failing to pick up a single point in his first three matches.

Gimnasia's win on Sunday ended a seven-match losing streak after Maradona decided to take action after being unable to arrest his team's slump.

After deciding to move the team's training sessions an hour away to Argentina's national team facilities, he also shunned some of his senior stars.

Jonathan Chacon, Guillermo Enrique, Lucas Miguez, Juan Cataldi, Khalil Caraballo, Eric Ramirez and Lucas Calderon had all been ousted before Sunday's game.

Under Maradona, Gimnasia have lost to Racing Club, Talleres de Cordoba and River Plate - and they face second-bottom Godoy Cruz at the weekend.
